alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 12:22AM EDT until March 26 at 4:17AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...In Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Ohio, Ripley and Switzerland Counties. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen today. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - This area has already received between 1.5 to 2 inches of rainfall over the last 24 hours. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Harrison, Batesville, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Hidden Valley, Bright, Versailles, Milan, Vevay, Osgood, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Moores Hill, Florence, Patriot, Guilford, Wilmington and Logan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
